identificationModule.briefTitle: A Prospective Cohort Study of Perioperative Covert Stroke and Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective Cohort Study of Perioperative Covert Stroke and Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction in Elderly Patients Undergoing Noncardiac Surgery

descriptionModule.briefSummary: With the development of population aging, the incidence of covert stroke and cognitive dysfunction gradually increased. Currently, there is still lack of prospective cohort study with large sample size on the relationship between perioperative covert stroke and postoperative cognitive dysfunction. The investigators will perform a prospective cohort study. The aim of the study is to determine whether there is an association between perioperative covert stroke and postoperative cognitive dysfunction in elderly patients undergoing noncardiac surgery.

primaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of perioperative covert stroke

secondaryOutcomes.description: Cognitive assessment will be conducted by trained research members who are blinded to the clinical diagnosis, treatment and MRI. The Mini-mental State Examination (MMSE) and Montreal cognitive assessment-basic (MoCA-B) will be used to assess the cognitive function. Postoperative cognitive dysfunction is defined as at least 2 standard deviation reduction in either assessment of MMSE or MoCA-B.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day before surgery; and 3 months, 1 year after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Confusion Assessment Method for the Intensive Care Unit scale (CAM-ICU) will be applied to assess delirium.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 4 hours, 24 hours, and 7 days after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) and Lawton instrumental activities of daily living scale (IADL) will be applied to assess the recovery quality.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day before surgery; and 30 days, 3 months after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: The quality of life will be assessed with the EuroQol-5D (EQ-5D) scale.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day before surgery; and 30 days, 3 months after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: Depression state will be assessed with the Geriatric Depression Scale.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day before surgery; and 30 days, 3 months after surgery

secondaryOutcomes.description: The incidence of myocardial infarction, cardiac arrest, pulmonary embolism, sepsis, surgical site infection and persistent postoperative pain.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Eligible patients were aged â‰¥60 years and scheduled for elective non-cardiac surgery with general anesthesia, with or without concomitant regional analgesia. They were expected to have surgery lasting at least 2 hours of anesthesia and to stay in the hospital at least 2 days thereafter.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients have MRI contraindications, and cannot complete the cognitive evaluation and refuse to sign informed consent will be excluded from the trial.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The population will be selected from patients who schedule to receive elective noncardiac surgery in Beijing Tiantan Hospital.

locations.facility: Chinese People's Liberation Army General Hospital
